result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan E Metzdorf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Fine is set at ZERO.
*Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation in Case Number 15CM3010. Cash Bail to apply.  Any remaining balance due at the end of that probation will become immediately due or civil judgment subject to tax intercept, to be entered.
Concurrent with: With Case Numbers: 15CF5289 and 15CM4406; with credit for 14 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan E Metzdorf

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan E Metzdorf in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
  
AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Case Numbers: 15CF5289 and 15CM4406; with credit for 14 days time served. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation in Case Number 15CM3010. Cash Bail to apply.  Any remaining balance due at the end of that probation will become immediately due or civil judgment subject to tax intercept, to be entered. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Defendant Jonathan E Metzdorf in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Jonathan E Metzdorf in custody.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Dodge Correctional.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Jonathan E Metzdorf not in court, in custody.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Jonathan E Metzdorf not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests more time. State does not object. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, Defendant Jonathan E Metzdorf not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing. Defendant's felony case (15CF005289) is set for a Jury Trial on 03-30-2016. Parties are awaiting the outcome of that case.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
No reply from defendant or surety.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Jonathan E Metzdorf not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Attorney Matthew Lamke is ill and cannot attend today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
